title: ApiNATOMY model
description: The ApiNATOMY model schema provides a contract for the JSON-based input data accepted by the ApiNATOMY lyph viewer, a web application that draws schematic models of physiology.

Anchor.description: Anchor defines a special point in a scaffold. Anchor points can join wires.

cardinal.description: Indicates whether an anchor is cardinal

hostedBy.description: A wire on which the given anchor is positioned

internalIn.description: ID or reference of the region in which this anchor must be positioned

onBorderInRegion.description: IDs or references of the region in which this anchor defines a border point

sourceOf.description: Wires that start in this anchor

targetOf.description: Wires that end in this anchor

anchoredNode.description: Node anchored by the current anchor point

schemaVersion.description: ApiNATOMY JSON Schema version used for model generation

lastUpdated.description: Date of the model last update

ScaffoldStateSchema.description: Selected properties of the scaffold that get serialized in a snapshot model

annotation.description: Annotation for the saved scaffold, e.g., version, author, etc.

Border.description: Lyph border schematically models the inner and outer surfaces of a body part whose structure is   defined by the lyph. Each border consists of an array that defines two radial and two longitudinal borders. The inner longitudinal border is always parallel to the lyph's rotational axis.

borders.description: Lyph or region borders listed in the clockwise order (starting from the inner longitudinal border in lyph). If this property is included to the input model, it must contain as many objects as there are border sides.

host.description: The ID or reference to the lyph or region object that owns this border. This property is set internally and should not be assigned.

Chain.description: Defines a chain of conveying lyphs

root.description: The source node of the chain (tree root)

leaf.description: The target node of the chain

lyphs.description: Ordered set of lyphs to form a chain

lyphTemplate.description: Lyph template to generate lyphs conveyed by the omega-tree branches.

numLevels.description: Number of levels in the generated chain. Nodes and links are auto-created

levels.description: Optional references to links or link properties that must be associated with the chain level. Excel property levelTargets can be used to name chain nodes

housingLyphs.description: A set of lyphs that house a chain

housingChain.description: A chain that houses the chain

housingRange.description: Index range to define the chain part that houses the chain

housingLayers.description: Indices of the layers in housing lyphs to embed the chain levels. The field should be used when the housing lyph layers are generated and not known in advance.

wiredTo.description: Scaffold wire that defines layout of the chain

startFromLeaf.description: When set to true, it connects chain's root to wire's target and its leaf to the wire's source

hostedBy.description: ID or reference of the lyph which this lyph must be projected to

Channel.description: Defines a chain of lyphs that transport materials

materials.description: Biological materials, chemical elements and compounds, conveyed by the channel

instances.description: Groups (subgraphs) that contain generated channel instances

Coalescence.description: Defines a group of lyphs with overlapping layers

abstract.description: A boolean flag to indicate that this coalescence is defined on abstract lyphs

generatedFrom.description: Coalescence with abstract lyphs or materials which was used to generate the current coalescence

lyphs.description: Coalescing lyphs, i.e., lyphs with overlapping layers

InterpolateColorScheme.description: Name of the color interpolation scheme as in d3-scale-chromatic

Component.description: Scaffold component includes resources to describe graphical layout for connectivity models

wires.description: Scaffold edges (property-restricted version of links, e.g., scaffold links are not conveyed by lyphs?)

regions.description: Areas occupied by the models of body organs, systems or surfaces that are not part of the connectivity model. Region can be defined by points or sequence of links (border)

CurieMapping.description: List of mappings used for external identifiers

Edge.description: A common abstract class for Link and Wire

stroke.description: Special edge stroke: dashed or thick

lineWidth.description: Edge line width, used in combination with `stroke` set to `dashed`

arcCenter.description: Center of an elliptic curve for an arc edge

curvature.description: Curvature of an arc or spline edge, defined as percentage of length

type.description: Resource category, i.e., FMA ontology, etc.

externalTo.description: Model resources corresponding to the given external resource

annotates.description: Model resources annotated by the given ontology term

documents.description: Model resources documented by the given reference

parent.description: Reference that contains the given published resource, i.e., a book contains a figure

children.description: Reference resources which are part of the given publication, i.e., book chapters or figures

Graph.description: The ApiNATOMY connectivity model is a complex graph that combines semantic resources and visual annotations. The graph nodes are arranged by the force-directed graph layout that respects constrains on relative positioning of the model elements, specified in the input data by the modeller.

abbrev.description: Short graph identifier for the use in rdfs:labels

localConventions.description: Mapping from local identifiers to global identifiers.

imports.description: URLs of published ApiNATOMY models to merge with the current model

scaleFactor.description: Number of pixels per unit of length, set in a generated model

Group.description: An ApiNATOMY model consists of an extended graph with nested subgraphs, called also groups, which define the structural composition of human body organs and/or subsystems, with related measurements and annotations.

inactive.description: A boolean flag to indicate that this group should not appear in the view panel

hidden.description: A boolean flag to indicate that this group is hidden

seed.description: A lyph that belongs to the group and serves as a starting point to populate the group

hostedBy.description: ID or reference of a region on which lyphs from the group must be projected to

generatedFrom.description: Group template which was used to generate the current lyph

nodes.description: Nodes connect separate links into semantically meaningful groups that reflect the organizational composition of body parts and/or flow in physiological processes.

links.description: Links schematically represent structural elements of the human physiology relevant to the explanation of a certain physiological process: blood vessels, neural connections, pulmonary vessels, etc.

lyphs.description: Lyphs provide schematic explanation of physiology structures, i.e., tissue layers that constitute a certain organ. By rotating the lyph shape around its axis, we can create a tube (open, semi-closed or closed on both sides) that structurally resembles a meaningful physiological element, i.e., a blood vessel or a neural cell.

materials.description: Biological materials, chemical elements and compounds, used in the model

coalescences.description: Coalescences, i.e., groups of overlapping lyphs

channels.description: Templates that define channel patterns. Channel templates are used to automatically generate groups (subgraphs) representing process chains within layers.

chains.description: Templates that define chain patterns. Chain templates are used to automatically generate groups (subgraphs) representing process chains.

trees.description: Templates that define arborization patterns within anatomy models. Tree templates are used to automatically generate groups (subgraphs).

groups.description: Semantically meaningful groups of resources that share common properties and are manipulated as a group, e.g., hidden or shown in the viewer.

scaffolds.description: Layout scaffolds that define connectivity graph layout

GroupColorScheme.description: Scheme to specify color interpolation for a group of resources

scheme.description: Interpolation scheme to apply to a group of resources

length.description: Number of distinct colors from the color scheme

reversed.description: Boolean parameter that indicates whether to pick up colors from the color scheme in reverse order

offset.description: Colors at the beginning and at the end of the color arrays may be too dark or too light, so we skip some percentage

GroupTemplate.description: An abstract resource that defines common properties for all types of generated subgraphs

hidden.description: A flag to indicate that group generated from this template will be hidden by default.

group.description: Group (subgraph) that encompasses generated group resources.

groupId.description: Desired identifier for a group generated from the given group template.

length.description: The total length of the maximal path in the group, used to compute the default length of generated subgraph links

conveyingType.description: Process type associated with links in the group derived from the template

IdentifierScheme.description: Resource reference: optional namespace with identifier

Link.description: Graph link schematically representing a (part of) physiological process.

length.description: The length of the edge (for links can be set, for wires usually computed)

hostedNodes.description: Nodes that are positioned on a link or border edge. If the same node is positioned on several edges, it is cloned and all its clones are connected by auto-generated collapsible dashed links with the original node.

conveyingLyph.description: Conveying lyph for the process represented by the link (other side of 'axis')

conveyingMaterials.description: Materials conveyed by a diffusive process, must be subset of materials in the innermost layer of the conveying lyph

levelIn.description: A chain that contains the link

endsIn.description: A lyph which contains one of the chain link ends

fasciculatesIn.description: A lyph which bundles the link

collapsible.description: Indicates that the link disappears when its end nodes are not both constrained

geometry.description: Defines the geometry and  behavior of the link in the model graph: `link` corresponds to a straight line, `semicircle` defines a line that looks like a semicircle, `rectangle` represents a rectangular line with rounded corners, `arc` represents a curve in the shape of an elliptic arc with given center, `path` is a solid path with control points defined by the edge bundling algorithm, `spline` is a link that uses preceding and following nodes on a path to smoothly connect existing links, `invisible` link is a link with a hidden visual object affected by graph forces that helps to position inner lyph content.

infoFields.description: Resource properties shown in the info panel when the resource is active, i.e., highlighted or selected

directed.description: When set to true, defines a directed edge with arrow at the end

reversed.description: When set to true, used to turn the link's conveying lyph by 180 degrees

strength.description: Link's strength reflects how strongly the link tries to satisfy its length constraint in the force-directed layout

prev.description: References to preceding links in ordered chains that pass through the current link

next.description: References to following links in ordered chains that pass through the current link

prevChainEndLevels.description: References to end levels of chains preceding the chains in which the current link is a level.

nextChainStartLevels.description: References to start levels of chains following the chain in which the current link is a level.

Lyph.description: Data structure that defines the material composition and topology of body parts and physiological processes

topology.description: Lyph topology defines its border shape

isTemplate.description: Indicates that the lyph defines layers for its subtypes

thickness.description: Anatomical lyph thickness defined in the form of power of 1/10

length.description: Anatomical lyph length defined in the form of power of 1/10

subtypes.description: Lyphs that are anatomical subtypes of the given lyph

supertype.description: Lyph which is an anatomical supertype of the given lyph

inheritedExternal.description: Identifiers of external resources inherited from all ancestors (supertypes)

inheritedOntologyTerms.description: Identifiers of ontology terms inherited from all ancestors (supertypes)

inheritedReferences.description: Identifiers of references inherited from all ancestors (supertypes)

layerIn.description: A lyph in which the current lyph is hosted as layer

internalIn.description: ID or reference of the lyph that contains the given lyph as its part

internalInLayer.description: Layer number of the lyph that contains the given lyph as its part

internalLyphs.description: Lyphs that are internal parts of the given lyph

internalNodes.description: Nodes that should be positioned on the given region

internalLyphColumns.description: Defines number of columns in the grid layout for the internal lyphs

internalLyphsInLayers.description: Indices of layers to position internal lyphs. The field should be used when layers are generated and not known in advance

internalNodesInLayers.description: Indices of layers to position internal nodes. The field should be used when layers are generated and not known in advance

hostedBy.description: ID or reference of the lyph which this lyph must be projected to

channels.description: ID or reference of the channel which this lyph houses

endBundles.description: A set of links (i.e., neural connections) that pass through the lyph

bundles.description: A set of links (i.e., neural connections) that pass through the lyph

bundlesChains.description: Chains that generate links that pass through the lyph. The property can be used to override default bundling of tree links to the outermost layer of a lyph

housingLyph.description: A derived property that links a lyph with it's housing lyph

seedIn.description: Dynamic group in which the given lyph is a seed

villus.description: Small, finger-like projections that extend into the lumen

inCoalescences.description: A set of coalescences that include the current lyph

generatedFrom.description: Material which was used to generate the current lyph

angle.description: Angle (in degrees) to rotate the lyph around its axis

infoFields.description: Resource properties shown in the info panel when the resource is active, i.e., highlighted or selected

width.description: Width of the visual object representing lyph. When set manually, should not exceed 100 (% of graph layout width)

height.description: Height of the visual object representing lyph. When set manually, should not exceed 100 (% of graph layout length)

scale.description: Defines the size of the conveying lyph as percentage of its axis' length

create3d.description: Create 3d visual objects for this lyph

layerWidth.description: Defines the percentage of the hosting lyph's width occupied by the given lyph as layer

Material.description: Biological materials, chemical elements and compounds

materials.description: Materials as constituent part of the current material

inMaterials.description: Materials which contain the current material

transportedBy.description: Channels that transfer the current material

Node.description: Graph node joins two or more links (processes)

infoFields.description: Properties shown in the info panel when the resource is active, i.e., highlighted or selected

hostedBy.description: A link on which the given node is positioned (other side of 'hostedNodes').

internalIn.description: ID or reference of the lyph which this lyph must be projected to

internalInLayer.description: Layer number of the lyph that the given done must be projected to

controlNodes.description: A set of nodes that define the position of the current node as their center of mass

layout.description: Positioning constraints, i.e., foci points that attract this node in the force-directed layout

fixed.description: Fixed nodes are positioned to the desired location

charge.description: Defines the force with which this node attracts or repels other nodes in the force-directed graph.

collide.description: Defines the radius for the collision force in the force-directed layout. The collision force treats nodes as circles with a given radius, rather than points, and prevents nodes from overlapping.

sourceOf.description: Links that start in this node

targetOf.description: Links that end in this node

rootOf.description: The chain that starts in this node

leafOf.description: The chain that ends in this node

anchoredTo.description: Scaffold anchor that defines node position

OffsetScheme.description: Offset scheme defines the start and the end values as well as a step for incremental selection of values in an array

Region.description: Area occupied by bordy part of subsystem

facets.description: A set of wires that define boundaries of the region. Shape points and boundaries can be generated from facets to visualize regions

hostedGroup.description: Resource group hosted by the region

hostedLyphs.description: Lyphs that should be projected to a given lyph

internalIn.description: ID or reference of the region that contains the current region as its part

internalRegions.description: Regions that are internal parts of the given region

depth.description: Can be used to order flat shapes on the same plane (polygonOffsetFactor, currently only applies to regions)

Resource.description: An abstract resource that defines common properties for all types of concepts in the ApiNATOMY model

description.description: Resource description, comments, modeling assumptions, etc.

generated.description: A boolean flag to mark automatically generated resources

assign.description: Dynamically assign properties to selected resources

value.description: A set of fields to be assigned to all resources that match the query in the path

interpolate.description: Dynamically apply property interpolation schemes to selected resources

color.description: Color interpolation schema for a group of resources

offset.description: Interpolation scheme to gradually set offsets for a set of resources

infoFields.description: Properties shown in the info panel when the resource is active, i.e., highlighted or selected

external.description: Identifier of a resource in an external ontology (i.e., ID of an FMA term)

references.description: Identifier of an evidence source in an external library

Scaffold.description: The ApiNATOMY scaffold model is an auxiliary structure that defines an abstract layout for a connectivity model.

localConventions.description: Mapping from local identifiers to global identifiers.

scaleFactor.description: Number of pixels per unit of length, set in a generated model

Shape.description: A resource that occupies space within a border

Tree.description: Templates that define arborization patterns within anatomy models. Tree templates are used to automatically generate groups (subgraphs).

chain.description: A chain resource defining the structural composition of the tree, i.e., lyphs that convey tree levels

branchingFactors.description: Branching factors define a mean value of branches at each tree level

instances.description: Groups (subgraphs) that contain generated tree instances

numInstances.description: Indicates how many tree instances to create

Vertice.description: A common abstract class for nodes and anchors

invisible.description: A flag to indicate that this node should not be visualized (view object is not created)

val.description: A value that defines the size of the vertice

offset.description: Defines position of the vertice on its host edge, i.e, fraction of the edge's length starting from the source vertice.

Villus.description: Defines a group of resources forming an intestinal villus

numLayers.description: Number of layers in the villus, or, equivalently, a layer index from which a villus starts

VisualResource.description: An abstract visual resource that defines common properties for all types of visual resources in the ApiNATOMY model.

viewObjects.description: Graphical objects that represent the resource

labels.description: Graphical objects that represent resource labels

hidden.description: A flag to indicate that this resource should not be visualized

inactive.description: A boolean flag to indicate that this visual resource should not be highlighted

skipLabel.description: A flag to indicate that this resource is visualized without the corresponding text label

cloneOf.description: A resource that was copied to create the current resource. This field is used to link resource clones to the original resource. We clone nodes that are hosted by more than one lyph border, and nodes, links and lyphs to generate an instance of an omega tree.

clones.description: Resources that are clones of the current resource. This field is used to link the resource to all its clones. We clone nodes that are hosted by more than one lyph border,  and nodes, links and lyphs to generate an instance of an omega tree.

Wire.description: Wire models a curve in a scaffold

geometry.description: Defines the geometry of the wire.

radius.description: Provides parameters a and b for elliptic wire

infoFields.description: Resource properties shown in the info panel when the resource is active, i.e., highlighted or selected

hostedAnchors.description: Anchors that are positioned on a wire.

controlPoint.description: Control point for the spline wire

facetIn.description: ID or reference of the region on which this wire is a facet

State.description: Saves visual state of a connectivity model and associated scaffolds

scaffolds.description: Scaffold properties to preserve (in practice, we save only relevant identifiers and anchor layout coordinates)

camera.description: Current setting of the scene camera

numDimensions.description: Number of dimensions for graph layout: 2 vs 3

showLabels.description: Visibility of labels for resource classes

labelContent.description: Label types (id vs name) for resource classes

Snapshot.description: Saves visual state of a connectivity model and associated scaffolds

model.description: An identifier of the saved model

annotation.description: Annotation for the saved model, e.g., version, author, etc.
